page.title: 14Methane Gas at Bilham
page.content: At Bilham Farm near Hooton Pagnell{ {methane gas}is being to be used to heat{greenhouses}.The{methane gas}is being given off by rotting{refuse}at an old quarry which has now been filled in.The owner of the farm hopes to have sixteen acres of{greenhouses. The plants that are grown there are going to be sent to Bilham nurseries to be sold.The farmer who is going to do it wants a worker who knows the area well.The trustees of Brodsworth estate have applied to Doncaster council for planning permission.It is a new use for{refuse}brought about by the application of modern{science and {technology}to heat the{greenhouses . Council dustbin lorries still tip their{refuse}there.At Warren disused quarry farmers and dustbin lorries tip there,perhaps in the future that could be used for the same perpose.
